question.para: Why is there two executable files, WinMerge.exe and WinMergeU.exe?

listitem.para: WinMerge.exe is ANSI executable which works in all 32-bit Windows systems. It does not have Unicode support.
WinMergeU.exe is Unicode enabled executable which works in Windows NT4, Windows 2000 and newer systems.

question.para: That splash screen is annoying, how do I turn it off?

answer.para: From menu, select Edit -> Options... -> Disable Splash Screen

question.para: When wanting to compare directories, I cannot select a directory in Browse?

answer.para: Are you trying to select a directory by clicking on it in the upper part of the Open File dialog ? The OpenFile dialog will then open it, and you have to push Ok again to get out.

question.para: WinMerge says "Binary files are different", but I am not comparing binary files?

answer.para: If you are using WinMerge.exe (not WinMergeU.exe), then your files may be Unicode files. WinMerge.exe cannot handle Unicode files. Please try comparing files with WinMergeU.exe if you have Windows NT4, Windows 2000 or newer.
Windows registry files (*.reg) are Unicode files (UTF-16 or UCS-2) -- see previous answer.
WinMerge can only show if binary files are identical or different.

question.para: Some characters are cut in half?

answer.para: Try selecting a different font from menu View -> Select Font...

question.para: I would like to see the line numbers?

answer.para: WinMerge shows current line in editor statusbar. WinMerge cannot show in-editor linenumbers. That is anyhow one feature we might consider for future releases.

question.para: How can I avoid temporary paths filling Open-dialog history lists?

answer.para: Tell program to invoke WinMerge with the /ub option, which tells WinMerge to not add the files to the MRU.
